alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 6:24PM MST until August 13 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWEST COCONINO COUNTY... At 617 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has ended over the warned area, Grand Canyon National Park around 10 miles east of Supai and 20 to 30 miles west of Grand Canyon Village. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon and flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Hundred and Twenty Mile Creek, Prairie Wash, Colorado River, Hundred and Twentyseven Mile Creek, Pasture Wash, Royal Arch Creek, Havasu Creek and Hundred and Twentyeight Mile Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
